title: Man's Hat, 18th century
medium:
Medium: silk, silver foil on silk core, flat silver foil
Technique: embroidered on plain weave
dimensions: H x circumference: 22.2 x 60 cm (8 3/4 x 23 5/8 in.)
creditline: Gift of Richard C. Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline E. Greenleaf
description: Yellow taffeta cap made up of four panels and deep turn-over border, each panel in crown and border embroidered with symmetrical chinoiserie floral sprays in silks in shades of blue in satin stitch and silver threads in satin and boucle stitch.  Edged up four seams and along top of border with silver metal bobbin lace.

exhibitions.title: The Cooper-Hewitt Collections: A Design Resource

tombstone.epitaph:
Man's Hat, 18th century.
18th century. Medium: silk, silver foil on silk core, flat silver foil
Technique: embroidered on plain weave. Gift of Richard C. Greenleaf in memory of his mother, Adeline E. Greenleaf. 1952-47-1.
